title: Software Engineer (Fullstack)
description:
CareMates - AI-supported patient admissions in the care sector

More time for care – less for paperwork and bureaucracy. With this mission, the founders of CareMates launched their journey at the end of 2023 in collaboration with Caritas in Munich, Germany, to digitalize one of the country's most essential pillars. In an aging society, the care sector is continuously growing while simultaneously struggling with severe staff shortages and high regulatory hurdles.

CareMates is the AI-powered CRM system for the social sector, streamlining inquiry and admission management for new residents and patients in care. Among the first customers are not only nonprofit organizations such as Caritas, Diakonie, and AWO but also private care providers.

In your role as a Software Engineer, you’re one of the first employees and therefore a crucial part of our 4-people engineering team. You closely collaborate with our two founders and Co-CTOs, Pablo and Johannes, and contribute to CareMates providing even more value for our clients.

Tasks

  • Build with a cutting-edge tech stack – Work with modern technologies such as TypeScript, Next.js, AWS, and Pulumi, while integrating state-of-the-art AI models (LLMs) and care/medical APIs to revolutionize digital patient admissions and take CareMates to the next level.
  • Shape technical architecture – Play a key role in architectural decisions, optimizing system design, performance, robustness, and scalability for the CareMates software.
  • Own and deliver impactful features – Take ownership of end-to-end feature development, from planning and design to implementation and deployment.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • 2+ years of experience in full-stack development with Python and TypeScript as well as hands-on experience with modern front-end frameworks like React and Next.js. - we also count relevant and impactful internships / working student positions
  • Experience in cloud-native development with AWS and knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Pulumi or Terraform.
  • Strong understanding of systems design, software architecture, and best practices in scalability and performance.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and a keen eye for diagnosing and resolving code and system health issues.
  • Comfortable working independently in a hybrid setup

Benefits

  • Impact-driven work – Contribute to a fast-growing startup that is transforming patient admissions and workflow automation in the healthcare sector.
  • Small, agile team – Work in a flat-hierarchy, fast-moving environment where decisions are made quickly, and your contributions directly shape the product.
  • Steep learning curve – Work on an innovative B2B SaaS product in the care sector, leveraging cutting-edge cloud technologies to solve real-world challenges.
  • Fair compensation & flexibility – Enjoy competitive pay, flexible working hours (fulltime required), and a fully remote setup, with the opportunity to work autonomously.
  • Weekly co-working slots – Meet the team in person and collaborate in a dynamic environment at Munich Urban Colab in Munich (~2-3 days/week)

We're looking forward to receiving your application!

Disclaimer: as we're a small and young company, please understand that we can only accept applications from candidates who are already located in Germany (e.g. student visa, Blue Card visa, etc.), as we cannot organize a full relocation for you.

Find more English Speaking Jobs in Germany on Arbeitnow

title: Software Engineer for German B2B SaaS Health-Tech Startup (remote)
description:
CareMates - AI-supported patient admissions in the care sector

  • As a remote engineer, you'd receive a longterm freelance contract from our German legal entity

Disclaimer: half of our engineering team is currently located in Queretaro, Mexico. Therefore, we only accept applications from candidates located in Mexico. Please understand that we cannot react to applications that do not fit this criteria.
